title: Collaborative Spatial Analysis and Digital Content Development for Achieving Sustainable Development Goals

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Geographic Information Systems (GIS) Understanding, Fundamental Wiki Editing Skills, and Statistical Data Processing Ability
context.additional_context: A program for mathematics majors to strengthen spatial data analysis and SDGs-linked competencies.

learning_goals: OpenStreetMap data can be utilized to analyze gender balance indicators in urban spaces with 85% accuracy

Learners will systematically edit three SDG-related spatial data entries (e.g., SDG 11-Sustainable Cities, SDG 13-Climate Action, SDG 15-Terrestrial Ecosystems) on Wikipedia. Using hyperlinks, they will connect at least two related documents (e.g., climate change, smart cities) and submit a final output by the end of the 6-month course that meets four or more of five digital citizenship criteria: accuracy, collaboration, creativity, connectivity, and social impact.

Learners will construct three or more mathematical models (linear/nonlinear regression, optimization models, etc.) using spatial information (coordinates, area, resource distribution) collected during collaborative mapping. Based on these models, they will propose sustainability solutions, such as improving energy efficiency by 15% or reducing waste by 20%.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
